July 9, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
On my return to New York this morning, I find
your letter of July first and the letter from your daughter
dated July third.

The bill for incidental expenses incurred in con-
nection with the History of Yellow Fever has been approved,
and you will receive reimbursement from the Comptroller's
office within a few days.

I am glad to have had the opportunity for confer-
ence with you and Doctor Pothier on the Colombian situation.
Doctor Hanson and Mr. Dunn are both due in New York today,
ready to sail on Wednesday.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
